titleStmt.title: William M. Webb to Ephraim L. Van Winkle
CWG2003

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Trimble County Ky --
December 23d 1864
Hon Secretary of
State of Kentucky
Sir
I desire an appointment from the Governor of Kentucky, of Notary Public for Trimble County Kentucky -- Send Commission & Fees to Sligo Henry County Ky

I have the honor to be sir
Your Obt Svt
William M Webb
Jr Eastin

Bedford Trimble County Ky Dec. 23d 1864
Hon Secty of
State of Kentucky
Sir

I am well acquanted with William M Webb Esqr, He is a gentleman of good, sober, habits and good character, is a magistrate of Trimble County Ky, a good Loyal citzen, and capaple of filling the office he applies for in his letter above.

I have the honor to be sir
Your Obt. Svt.
Wm F Peak Clerk Trimble
Circuit & County Courts

Trimble Co
Notary Public
Wm M. Webb
apptd
27th Dec/64
